title: Rum-Glazed Pork Tenderloin
description: Tender roasted pork tenderloin finished with a sticky rum-spiked glaze that balances brown sugar, citrus, and mustard. Quick to roast and ideal for weeknight or weekend dinners, served sliced with pan sauce for maximum flavor.

ingredients.notes: trim silver skin and excess fat
use dark or aged rum for depth
zest 1 tsp of orange for extra aroma

ingredients.display_name: soy sauce (or coconut aminos for paleo)
ingredients.notes: provides umami; swap for coconut aminos to avoid soy
mix with equal parts cold water

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 400째F (205째C). Pat the pork tenderloin dry with paper towels and season all over with half the salt and half the pepper.

Heat a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. When shimmering, sear the tenderloin on all sides until browned, about 2-3 minutes per side, using tongs to roll the meat for even color.

Transfer the skillet with the seared tenderloin to the preheated oven and roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part reads 140째F (60째C) for medium, about 12-15 minutes depending on thickness.

While the pork roasts, make the rum glaze: combine rum, brown sugar, Dijon mustard, orange juice and zest, soy sauce, minced garlic, thyme, remaining salt and pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using) in a small saucepan.

Bring the glaze to a simmer over medium heat and reduce until syrupy and slightly thickened, about 6-8 minutes. If a thicker finish is desired, whisk a cornstarch slurry into the glaze and simmer 1 minute more. Stir in butter off heat to add shine.
When the pork reaches target temperature, remove from oven and transfer to a cutting board; tent loosely with foil and rest 5-7 minutes. Reserve skillet juices for the sauce if desired.
Slice the rested tenderloin into medallions, brush generously with the rum glaze or spoon glaze over slices. Serve with additional warm glaze on the side and garnish with extra thyme or orange zest.
